title: Łódź
summary: Łódź,[lower-alpha 1] also rendered in English as Lodz,[lower-alpha 2] is the third largest city in Poland and a former industrial centre. Located in the central part of the country, it has a population of 672,185 (2020).[1] It is the capital of Łódź Voivodeship, and is located approximately 120 km (75 mi) south-west of Warsaw.[8] The city's coat of arms is an example of canting, as it depicts a boat (łódź in Polish), which alludes to the city's name.
